tweet: On the first day of my Sixth District Farm Tour, I had the opportunity to visit Showalter’s Orchards & Greenhouse, @WOLF_Lavender, Marshall Farms, and Cave View Farms. Agriculture is essential to Virginia's economy, and I am thankful to represent such a diverse region. pic.twitter.com/tngK64IwEH

The 2018 Farm Bill legalized the production of hemp as an agricultural commodity. I’m pleased I was able to work with my Virginia colleagues to ensure that the Commonwealth was included in AgriLogic’s crop insurance pilot program for industrial hemp. https://www.roanoke.com/news/local/virginia-s-inclusion-sought-in-crop-insurance-program-for-industrial/article_ad64bde3-19cd-5912-a9b6-d95de74b6450.html?utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter&utm_campaign=user- …

As a former prosecutor, I know all too well how the Debbie Smith Act has made incredible progress to reduce DNA backlogs in sexual violence cases. I am shocked the Democrats will not consider this bipartisan legislation, and I urge its immediate approval. pic.twitter.com/gYIdtXBJyH

Yesterday, @POTUS and @JPN_PMO announced a trade deal that will eliminate or reduce tariffs on $7.2 billion of U.S. food and agricultural products, helping U.S. beef, corn, pork and other farmers. This is great news for VA farmers and will expand markets for American products. pic.twitter.com/4WQMQt90kT

Despite House Speaker Nancy Pelosi caving to the far-left of her party on impeachment, I remain focused on doing the job that I was elected to do by the citizens of the Sixth District. https://cline.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-cline-statement-impeachment-inquiry …

Yesterday @SecretarySonny of the @USDA joined me for a tour of Mt. Crawford Creamery. “You Are Not Forgotten” are more than words used to remember the sacrifices and service of those who were prisoners of war (POW), missing in action (MIA), and their families. Outside my office is a POW/MIA flag that reminds me of those who sacrificed their lives & their freedom. pic.twitter.com/1hMDvXlBAj
